post.body: reminds me of "the credit card prank" - involved doodles of the digestive system, must read: http://www.zug.com/pranks/credit/
i saw pendulum at coachella and they were amazing. enmores also a good venue. i'd be interested in going.
omg. when will i get to the point in my life where 1) i look like rihanna and 2) people pour smirnoff onto me?
- my fault. it takes a while to write a polished article. there are a *lot* of demos in the demo gallery though, check those out.
right you are.. and here i thought i was just being american-centric. thankz 4 the link
: im fairly certain that the HTML5 spec officially deprecates british spelling. it was just a fad anyway.
- they already have a native slider (input type="range") and editable dropdown (input type="list"?).
im proud to say i spent hours in line for a maddox book signing + that i made a foam pirate flag with his silhouette 4 it.
technically possible, but against the terms of use. our static maps API is only allowed to be used inside web browsers. sorry!
i wanted to make "googley or not" gadget for internal network. the idea was deemed un-googley itself. :(
google maps api supports AIR... maybe u should put a map in it! show me nearby tweets.. very important.

debate w/@enneff-what is cuter, otters (http://tinyurl.com/5uk5nc) or capybaras (http://tinyurl.com/57khrj)?
sydney is the only city where i'm repeatedly asked to *redo* my signature cuz it doesnt look enuf like the one on my credit card. crazy.
guykawasaki #1 douche: +1. he needs to stop forcing his apple religion down my throat. *gag*. http://shortyawards.com/category/douche
i love the ghetto-ness but yet awesome-ness of the Huge Crab repository: http://www.hugecrab.com/ 90s webpages, ftw
arrrghh.. im so close to getting multiple youtube videos to play inside a flex app..but so far. why couldn't flash have *always* been AS3?

i drew a caricature of a caricaturist, and he tore it up cuz he was saddened by how old he looked in it. :(

just added full screen mode to santa map.. flex makes some things so easy (and other things so hard). now, where can i find egg nog in SYD?
jus had a wicked fun sunday -- beach, frisbee, sausage roll, guitar, singing lesson, homemade chicken stir fry, TED talks. now for SANTA!

a googler from the US is in town. anyone up for showing him a good time in SYD tonight? (dining/drinking/dancing?)

observation: walking around downtown sydney in a santa hat seems to be a good way to encourage user interaction.
hmmm..i wanna talk @ ignite sydney, seems like a good exercise. but what about? maps? spreadsheets hacks? html 5? sidewalk chalk? flex?
merging my JS code with an external agency's JS code while debugging IE6.. 2 of my least favorite activities!
